resources.string: The cat (Felis catus), commonly referred to as the domestic cat or house cat, is a small domesticated carnivorous mammal.
Rabbits are small mammals in the family Leporidae (which also includes the hares), which is in the order Lagomorpha (which also includes pikas).
Chameleons are a family of lizards. Most can change the colour of their skins for camouflage, or to signal mood to other chameleons.
Deer constitute the second most diverse family of artiodactyla after bovids.
Ducklings are young ducks in downy plumage1. They are small and fluffy with large webbed feet.
A giraffe is a mammal that lives in Africa. It is the tallest land animal, reaching an overall height of 18 ft (5.5 m) or more

A parrot is a tropical and subtropical bird that belongs to the order Psittaciformes. They are characterized by large heads, upright stance, strong and clawed zygodactyl feet, and strong and curved beaks.
Penguins are flightless seabirds that live almost exclusively below the equator. They have countershaded dark and white plumage and flippers for swimming.
A puppy is a juvenile dog. Some puppies can weigh 1–1.5 kg (2.2–3.3 lb), while larger ones can weigh over 7 kg (15 lb).
Squirrels are small rodents with slender bodies, bushy tails and large eyes. They have strong hind legs and a hairy tail.
The tiger (Panthera tigris) is the largest living cat species1. It is most recognizable for its black stripes on orange fur with a white underside.
